intro: Erythracanthus griffithianus, commonly known as the Griffith's erythracanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and evergreen leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous terrain, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent stamens, making it visually distinctive. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
